meanings.definition: To write or engrave (words or characters) above or on something.
meanings.sent1: She superscribes her name on the cover of her notebook.
meanings.sent2: The artist superscribes the title of the painting above the image.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel superscribes its name on the tree trunk with acorns.
meanings.sent4: His love for her superscribes itself on his heart, never to be erased.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization superscribes their history on stone tablets for future generations to read.

meanings.definition: To sign one's name at the end of a document.
meanings.sent1: He always superscribes his signature at the bottom of the contract.
meanings.sent2: The author superscribes his name on the last page of the book.
meanings.sent3: The cat humorously superscribes its paw print at the end of the letter.
meanings.sent4: Her influence superscribes her mark on every decision made in the company.
meanings.sent5: The champion's legacy superscribes itself in the annals of sports history.
